results.title: Little Lord Fauntleroy
results.creator_credit: David O. Selznick and John Cromwell
results.brief_description: Cedric is a spoilt child brought up in Brooklyn in the 1880’s who inherits an English title and finds his life transformed. In his stately family home in England, Cedric wins over his stern grandfather (C. Aubrey Smith). Freddie Bartholomew stars in the title role and is well supported by Dolores Costello as his mother and Mickey Rooney as the bootblack.

results.title: Little Lord Fauntleroy
results.creator_credit: Richard Callanan, BBC and Andrew Morgan
results.brief_description: Twelve year-old Cedric Erroll’s world is turned upside down when, completely unexpectedly, a lawyer from London arrives with the news that he is the grandson and rightful heir to the vast lands and fortunes of the Earl of Dorincourt. So, Little Lord Fauntleroy and his mother leave their humble New York abode to live in a castle in England. However, he soon finds that money doesn’t necessarily bring happiness. His bitter and often cruel grandfather refuses to allow Cedric’s mother into his home. Starring Michael Benz as Cedric, George Baker of Inspector Wrexford fame as the Earl of Dorincourt and Betsy Brantley as Cedric’s mother. A triumph of good over bad, the new world over the old, this timeless story has captured the hearts of both children and adults alike for generations. Based on the novel by Frances Hodges Burnett.

results.title: Little journey
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Keith Nguyen and ACMI
results.brief_description: Keith remembers little of his early years - separated from his parents and living with his grandparents. His father had been sent to a Re-education Camp and his mother had moved away. On his father’s release from the Camp the family was reunited and several years later they escaped from the hardships of Vietnam to seek a better life in Australia.

results.title: Little Johnny Jones
results.creator_credit: Bill Siegler, Group W Cable Productions, Showtime Entertainment and Gary Halvorson
results.brief_description: This Goodspeed Opera House production of George M. Cohan’s classic American musical “Little Johnny Jones” is performed on stage in front of a live audience and features such hit songs as “Yankee Doodle Dandy” and “Give my regards to Broadway”. The cast includes Eric Weitz as Johnny Jones and Peter Van Norden as Anthony Anstey, with Lenny Wolpe, Ernie Sabella, Bruce Chew, Jack Bittner, Maureen Brennan, Anna Mcneely, Jane Galloway. Book, music and lyrics by George M. Cohan adapted by Alfred Uhry and stage direction by Gerald Gutierrez.

constellations_other.name: Drawing on influences
constellations_other.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

constellations_other.name: Warwick Thornton
constellations_other.description: Brimming with Shakespearean undertones and pathos, Kaytetye filmmaker Warwick Thornton's debut feature Samson and Delilah is both a universal tale and one intrinsically tied to the experience of First Peoples in Central Australia.

results.title: Little houses for little people
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid, Ronald A Weinberg, Micheline Charest, BRB International, Miramax Films and Cinar Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World of David the Gnome”.
David tells us more about the magical world of the gnomes. In “Little houses for little people” he explains the gnomes’ secret and special underground houses. “The wedding that almost wasn’t” - All the Gnomes gather to celebrate a wedding - but the trolls are unwelcome guests! Based on “The gnomes” by Rien Poortvliet and Wil Huygen. Narrated by Christopher Plummer.

results.title: Little golden memories
results.creator_credit: Jim Bousman and Western Publishing Company
results.brief_description: Stories from twelve of the best loved Little Golden Books. - Poky little puppy and the patchwork blanket. - Theodore Mouse goes to sea. - Tawny scrawny lion. - Sailor dog. - Rupert the rhinoceros. - Jack and the beanstalk. - Saggy baggy elephant. - Little toad to the rescue. - Scruffy the tugboat. - Three Billy Goats Gruff. - Little Red Riding Hood. - What was that?

results.title: Little girl Jaed
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This drama recounts a girl’s tragic journey of drug addiction. Feelings of isolation and loneliness mount as a girl struggles with everyday life - at school and at home. Her friends begin to reject her, as her family does when they can no longer cope with her behaviour. As she tries to come to grips with her dependency, her family bond comes to breaking point and she is eventually thrown out of the family home. A bleak story of how drug addiction can ruin a person’s life.

results.title: Little Flower = Xiao Hua [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Beijing Film Studio and Zhang Zheng
results.brief_description: Set in 1930, this melodrama focuses on the fate of two sisters who are separated as babies and grow up in different families unaware of each other’s existence. They are reunited by chance as young adults after they join the People’s Liberation Army where they also discover their long lost brother. Cast includes Joan Chen, Liu Xiaoquing, Cheng Chong and Guoqiang Tang. In Mandarin with English subtitles.
